text: Hi <!here|@here>, I have a beginner environment question. I was just restarting and updating my VM to pull in the latest changes and when I run the server, it kicks off an unhandled exception: `AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'ShopifyResource'`. The git repo on the VM is up-to-date with the plant_import branch, so there must be another step I'm missing. Should I run the puppet incantation (from the README) inside the VM?

I just added a new python module requirement (a Shopify API library), so need to re-run installation of all libs in requirements.txt like this:
`/data/code/pythonenv/bin/pip install -r requirements.txt`
if that doesn’t work, ping me directly. it works fine on actual deployed boxes, but Vagrant is fussy sometimes

one more note, please make sure that `shopify` directory in the project root is not there. i removed it from git, but when doing a git pull elsewhere, it didn’t automatically remove the directory. it’s no longer needed and python was confusing that directory w/ the new Shopify module
Cool cool... it's working fine after I removed the shopify directory, ran the pip install, and did the migration it asked for. Thanks again!
